casebody.data:
Kathlyn Marie STEIN and Michael Hootstein
v.
ASHEVILLE CITY BOARD OF EDUCATION, Cooperative Learning Center (also known as Wolfe Creek School), now Buncombe Community School West, at the time administered jointly by Blue Ridge Human Services Facilities, Inc. and/or Blue Ridge Mental Health and/or Asheville City Board of Education and/or Buncombe County Board of Education, Buncombe County Board of Education, Blue Ridge Center for Mental Health, and Blue Ridge Area Authority. No. 128A05. Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 29, 2006. David W. Hood, Michael J. Barnett, Hickory, for Cooperative Learning Center, et al. Mark A. Leach, Winston-Salem, Leslie O. Wickham, Jr., Durham, for Stein & Hootstein. Richard Schwartz, Raleigh, Michael Delafield, for Asheville City Bd. of Education. K. Dean Shatley, II, Asheville, for Buncombe County Bd. of Education. Prior report: 360 N.C. 321 , 626 S.E.2d 263 .

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Plaintiffs on the 7th day of April 2006 for rehearing of the decision of this Court pursuant to Rule 31, N.C. Rules of Appellate Procedure, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 29th day of June 2006."

Justice TIMMONS-GOODSON recused.
